translation.en: -[man 1, muffled] Hot enough for you? -[woman 1] She's tried everything.
[woman 2] What about the looks she was getting…
[man 2] We were all, frankly, keen on…
[woman 3] No, it's not right for a girl.
[woman 4] …giving you any more money to…
-[man 2] Look at it this way… -[woman 5] It's simple to me.
[man 3] I must stay away from…
[woman 6] Feels like the whole city is out today.
[woman 7] Summer sales.
translation.ko: 여름 세일이잖아 뉴욕 사람들이 놓칠 리 없지

translation.en: -Can't keep a New Yorker from a bargain. -[woman 6] Ain't that the truth?
translation.ko: 여름 세일이잖아 뉴욕 사람들이 놓칠 리 없지 그러게

translation.en: Let's get to the toy store and out of this heat.
I'll never hear the end of it if I don't get my niece a doll.
translation.ko: 인형 안 사주면 조카가 계속 조를 거야

translation.en: [woman 7] She asking for some special sort?
They have those ones with darling hair you can braid.
translation.ko: 머릿결 예쁜 인형도 팔더라 땋을 수도 있어

translation.en: -[woman 6] Yes, maybe she'd like that. -[man 6 whistles] Taxi!
-[woman 6] Oh. -[woman 7] There now, that's better.
[woman 6] Look at that precious little pickaninny one.
-That, she'll love. -No.
[woman 6] She's never even met a colored who didn't work for us. Thank heavens.
No, never mind, ladies. Accidents will happen.
translation.ko: 신경 쓰지 마세요 사고는 생기게 마련이죠

translation.en: -[woman 6] My goodness. -Here you are.
-[shopper] Here. -[woman 6] Oh! Thank you.
-What a nice lady. -[woman 6] Mm-hmm.
[clerk] There you go, miss. Thank you so much.
-[woman 8] Thank you. -[girl] Mama, I want that one.
[shopper] Do you have the Mother Goose Drawing and Tracing Book?
[clerk] All sold out.
Figures. I've tried all over town. My son won't settle for anything but.
translation.ko: 역시나, 도시를 다 뒤졌어요 아들이 그것만 찾을 텐데

translation.en: [clerk] Try again in a couple weeks. Might get lucky.
translation.ko: 몇 주 뒤에 들어올 수도 있어요

translation.en: -His birthday's tomorrow. -[clerk] Well, better luck next time.
[clerk] Thank you.
[man 1] Mister? Hey, are you all right, sir?
Please, somebody, help me. I… I… Help me out.
He's fallen down. Sir, can you hear me?
[man 2] Sir. Sir, you all right?
-[woman] What's happened? -I don't know.
[woman] He all right?
[driver] This heat. Feels like I'm about to pass out myself.
translation.ko: 어찌나 더운지 기절할 것 같은 날씨군요

translation.en: Yes. I guess it's tea I need. I'm a little faint.
[driver] The Drayton, ma'am? They do say as how there's always a breeze up there.
translation.ko: 드레이턴으로 모실까요? 거긴 늘 시원하다고 소문이 났더군요

translation.en: -[shopper] The Drayton would be lovely. -[indistinct chatter]
[man] Oh! Taxi!
Take him to a hospital.
Thank you.
-Good afternoon. -Good afternoon.
[man 1] The waiter will be with you.
[woman 1 whispering] Stop it.
-Now? -[man 2] Yes, now.
[woman 1] You satisfied?
[man 3] See you later.
[woman 2] Don't be long. I'll get another one.
translation.ko: 너무 늦지 마, 외로운 거 싫어

translation.en: [man 3] I won't. I hope.
-You'll be all right? -[woman 2] I'll be just fine.
I'm going to sit here and enjoy this cool room.
-[man 3] All right. -[woman 2] All right.
-[man 3] I suppose I should… -[woman 2] I suppose you should.
Pardon me. I don't mean to stare, but I think I know you.
[shopper] I'm afraid you're mistaken.
No, of course I know you, Rene.
You look just the same. Tell me, do they still call you Rene?
[Irene] Yes, though no one's called me that for a long time.
Don't you know me?
Not really, Rene?
I'm afraid I can't seem to place…
-Clare? -[Clare] Mm-hmm.
That's right.
-Not Clare Kendry? -[Clare] Mm-hmm.
Now, don't run away.
You simply must stay and talk.
Fancy meeting you here. It's simply too lucky.
It's awfully surprising, yes.
I'd never have known you if you hadn't laughed.
You've changed so. Well, it's been 12 years at least.
You know, I almost dropped by your father's house not so long ago.
translation.ko: 얼마 전에 너희 아버지 댁에 들를까 생각했어

translation.en: I've thought of you so often.
-You have? -[Clare] Of course.
You know, since I've been here, I've hoped I might run into someone.
translation.ko: 여기 온 후로 누구라도 마주치길 바랐거든

translation.en: Preferably you, though. And now you're here.
translation.ko: 널 보면 더 좋고 그런데 이렇게 만났네

translation.en: I'll wager you haven't given me a thought.
So…
Tell me.
I want to know everything. Married? Children?
-Yes. Two boys. You? -Mm-hmm.
One girl. Margery. She's my angel.
translation.ko: 딸 하나고 이름은 마저리야 정말 사랑스러워

translation.en: My husband John's here on business.
Banking business. In this heat! Can you imagine?
That was your husband?
[chuckles softly] We've been here a whole week from Chicago. That's home.
translation.ko: 집은 시카고야 도착한 지 일주일 됐어

translation.en: Although I come here and remember what home really is.
translation.ko: 여기 오니까 진짜 고향이 뭔지 알겠다

translation.en: Well, we can see lots of one another these days that I'm here, can't we?
translation.ko: 아무튼 여기 있는 동안 자주 보자, 알겠지?

translation.en: I don't know… I mean… I'm just…
I live in Harlem, still.
I don't come to this part of town a whole lot.
Oh, that's sad.
Perhaps I can come visit with you another time in Harlem?
Meet your boys?
We're here quite often.
And if this trip goes well, well, John's quite sure we'll move.
translation.ko: 존 말로는 일이 잘되면 이사할 수도 있대

translation.en: It's my dream to come back, Rene.
I'm sure.
Clare…
does he…
Know?
Let's go up to my suite, where we can talk properly.
Waiter!
Ugh. I can't bear this heat! I have to change.
translation.ko: 더워서 못 살겠다! 옷 좀 갈아입을게

translation.en: John'll be back soon.
And here I am, sweatin' up a storm.
-That's nice. -Oh!
I found Gert Johnson in the phone book. Well, Gertrude Martin now.
translation.ko: 전화번호부에서 거트 존슨 찾았어 이젠 거트루드 마틴이지

translation.en: She married Fred. Remember?
Yes. I haven't seen Fred for an unmentionable time.
translation.ko: 응, 프레드 못 본 지 한참 됐네

translation.en: Well, they have twins. Isn't that wonderful?
-Mmm. -Boys. Oh, I'd love boys.
I'd never risk it again, though.
I went through hell those nine months for fear Margery might turn out dark.
translation.ko: 마저리 피부색이 어두울까 봐 얼마나 걱정했다고

translation.en: Mine are dark.
Oh. And your husband, he…
He… couldn't exactly "pass," if that's what you mean.
translation.ko: - 네 남편이… - 그이는… 패싱 못 해, 그걸 묻는 거면

translation.en: Oh, I thought…
Oh, well, then. [chuckles]
Would you?
Would you?
Well, anyway, she goes as white.
-So, you haven't ever thought to? -What?
I'm asking if you ever thought of passing, Rene.
translation.ko: 백인 행세 할 생각 한 번도 안 해봤어?

translation.en: No, why should I?
I mean, for convenience, occasionally, I suppose. But no.
translation.ko: 가끔 편의상 해도 계속할 생각은 없어

translation.en: I just mean I have everything I've ever wanted.
Except perhaps a little more money. [scoffs]
Of course. That's all anybody ever wants, a little more money.
translation.ko: 맞아, 누구나 돈이라면 좀 더 많이 갖고 싶어 해

translation.en: Money's an awfully nice thing to have.
In fact, all things considered, I think it's entirely worth the price.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 모든 걸 고려했을 때 그만한 가치가 있어

translation.en: I should go, Clare.
I'm not sure it's such a good idea if John…
translation.ko: 네 남편 오기 전에 가는 게…

translation.en: Oh, no, Rene, it is.
Oh, you must stay a little while longer. Oh, please say you'll stay.
translation.ko: 조금만 더 있다 가 제발 가지 말아줘

translation.en: Hang it! I've made a mess.
Give me a second, and I'll order us some food up here.
All right.
Whatcha thinking, Rene?
You're curious, is that it?
You can ask me anything. Anything you want.
What have you told him… of your family?
translation.ko: 남편한텐 뭐라고 했어? 네 가족 얘기

translation.en: You know, I haven't had to worry as much as you'd think.
There were my aunts, you see. They took me in after Father died and gave me a home of sorts.
[exhales deeply] Very white, very respectable, very religious.
translation.ko: 전형적 백인에 점잖은 분들이야 신앙심도 깊지

translation.en: I met John not long after,
and as soon as I turned 18 and legal, we got married and…
well, went off and left for good.
And you're happy?
Of course, Rene.
As you say, I have everything I ever wanted.
translation.ko: 네 말처럼 원하는 건 다 가졌지

translation.en: I'm sorry, Clare, that was rude of me.
Of course you're happy.
-Look at you. -[Clare chuckles]
-And your daughter? -Margery? Oh, she's divine.
John wants to put her in one of those Swiss boarding schools in the fall.
I dare say she'll get quite the education. Not like anything we had.
translation.ko: 걘 우리랑 다르게 좋은 교육을 받을 거야

translation.en: Room service, hello?
We want cakes. The most beautiful cakes you have.
Tell me, what tea you got passes for French champagne?
translation.ko: 프랑스 샴페인처럼 보이는 차는 뭐가 있죠?

translation.en: Oh, I'm messing!
Yes, we'll take a pitcher of iced tea in champagne flutes.
translation.ko: 네, 아이스티 한 병을 샴페인 잔에 갖다줘요

translation.en: Mm-hmm. We're celebrating.
-[Irene] That's enough, thank you. -Have a drop more. You've hardly had any.
translation.ko: - 됐어, 고마워 - 더 마셔, 거의 안 마셨잖아

translation.en: -[John] Nig? -John, dear! [kisses]
I ran into an old, old friend of mine from school.
Irene Westover. Irene, this is my husband, John Bellew.
translation.ko: 아이린 웨스트오버야 여긴 내 남편 존 벨류고

translation.en: Pleasure to meet you, Mrs. Westover.
-Actually, it's Mrs. Redfield. -[John] Mm.
Oh, of course, I… I didn't even think to ask.
I am sorry if I've interrupted.
-Will you get me a drink, honey? -[Clare] Here.
translation.ko: 한 잔 줄래, 여보? - 여기 - 고마워

translation.en: [John] Thank you.
So, what do you say, then? To old friends?
-To old friends! -To old friends.
-Did you hear what John called me, Rene? -Oh, Clare, please.
translation.ko: - 내 별명 들었어, 리니? - 그러지 마

translation.en: [Clare] No, go on, tell her why.
[John chuckles] Oh, it's silly.
When we were first married, this woman was as white as a lily.
translation.ko: 우리가 결혼했을 때 클레어는 순백의 백합 같았어요

translation.en: But as the years go by, she seems to be getting darker and darker.
So I told her, "If you don't look out, you'll wake up one morning
translation.ko: 그래서 조심 안 하면 어느 날 아침에 일어났을 때

translation.en: and find that you've turned into a nigger."
Yeah. She's been Nig ever since.
That's good!
Well, it's silly.
No, that's… That's…
That's good.
My goodness, John!
After all these years, what would it matter
if you found out that I was 1 or 2% colored, hmm?
translation.ko: 살짝 섞였다 한들 인제 와서 그게 중요해?

translation.en: Well, you can turn as black as you please, as far as I'm concerned.
I know you're not colored.
So, you dislike Negroes, Mr. Bellew?
No, no, no, not at all. I hate them.
But not as much as Nig does, for all she's trying to turn into one.
Why, she won't have them near her, not even as a maid.
Isn't that true?
Have you ever known any Negroes?
[John] No, no, but I do know people who know them.
translation.ko: 그건 아니지만 흑인을 아는 지인들이 있죠

translation.en: And I read about them in the papers, of course.
Terrible mess. Robbing, killing.
[sighs] It's sad, really.
John, Rene doesn't want to hear about your pet perversions.
translation.ko: 존, 리니는 당신의 별난 혐오감 얘긴 안 듣고 싶을걸

translation.en: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to bore you.
You live nearby?
Fairly.
[John] It's a great city, New York. City of the future.
-What line of work is your husband in? -He's a doctor.
-[John] That's an interesting life. -[Irene] Yes. Hard. Nerve-racking too.
Wife's nerves, too, I bet. All those lady patients.
translation.ko: 아내로서도 긴장되겠어요 여자 환자를 많이 볼 테니

translation.en: John, dear, don't start! More tea, Rene?
translation.ko: 존, 그만해! 차 더 줄까, 리니?

translation.en: I've taken up too much of your time already.
Oh, but we're just getting started!
-Thank you for the drink. -[John] I'll see you out.
[Clare] Rene.
-I do hope to see you soon. -Goodbye, Mrs. Redfield.
translation.ko: - 또 봤으면 좋겠어 - 안녕히 가세요, 부인

translation.en: -Glad to have met you. -[Irene] Goodbye, Clare.
-[Irene] Evening, Lance. -Evening.
Where you been?
Lookin' for that darn book.
-They eat? -I think so.
I was gonna put them to bed, but…
-But you fell asleep. -Apparently.
Am I still sleeping?
Catch it!
Pass, pass.
[husband] Hey. Come here.
-I thought you nailed this already. -[son 1] I forget sometimes.
[husband] All right, ten minutes.
-[son 1] Catch the ball, okay? -[son 2] I don't want to.
[son 1] Don't lose it.
It's boring. Play with me.
[son 2] Just leave me alone.
Damn!
-Caught! -[gasps] Damn it!
Brian, why you gotta be creepin' around the place like that?
Profanity, miss!
They'll be late for school.
I'm not gonna have time to make it to my next call if I have to drop you.
translation.ko: 당신 데려다주면 다음 환자 방문에 늦을 것 같아

translation.en: -[maid] Boys, come on in. -Irene?
[maid] Yes, yes, you have to come on in now.
Sorry, honey.
I was just thinking how much Junior is getting like you.
translation.ko: 주니어가 점점 당신을 닮아가는 것 같아

translation.en: I wonder if he isn't going too fast in school.
It's easy to forget he's younger.
I wish you wouldn't be ever fretting about those boys.
translation.ko: 애들 걱정은 대체 언제까지 할 셈이야?

translation.en: They are fine. They're perfectly good, strong, healthy boys.
I suppose.
I'm just afraid he's picked up some queer ideas about things from some of the older boys.
translation.ko: 괜히 형들한테서 이상한 거 배우면 어쩌나 해서

translation.en: "Queer"? What about?
You know, things young boys be thinking about.
Ah. You mean about sex?
Yes. Jokes. Things like that.
If sex isn't a joke, what is it?
-What is a joke? -Don't be facetious.
You ready?
No, you go. I'll take the bus.
translation.ko: 아니, 먼저 가, 버스 타고 갈게

translation.en: -Pick you up, then? -Please. From the printing office.
I need to see about more handbills and tickets for the dance.
They should be paying you.
It isn't charity work if they pay me for it.
translation.ko: 돈 받고 일하면 자선 활동이 아니지

translation.en: -[maid] Go on, boys. -[Brian] Are we ready?
[Irene] Lickety-split!
-Come back. -Are you ready?
-I'm fast. -Let's go.
-Go on, boys, get. -Junior.
-[son 2] I don't wanna go! -[Brian] You have to, I'm afraid.
[Junior] Bye, Mama.
-I'm too fast! Can't catch me. -[son 2] Get back here.
translation.ko: - 너무 빨라서 못 잡을걸 - 이리 와

translation.en: -You want grapefruit, ma'am? -Mm-hmm.
Thank you.
Ugh, my hat.
Oh, Ms. Redfield, you forgot one.
Thank you.
-Do you want me to drive? -Mmm.
Yeah, sure.
Everything set?
We're a month away and all the bookings are gone, not counting the door.
translation.ko: 한 달 남았는데 예매 끝났어 현장 판매 표만 남았지

translation.en: -Busy as a cat with fleas myself. -Ain't you cold?
No, leave it, if you're not cold.
[sighs] This city!
I think I'm beginning to hate sick people.
Their stupid meddling families, their dirty, smelly rooms--
translation.ko: 멍청한 가족들 참견에 더럽고 냄새나는 병실까지

translation.en: Come on, now. It's just a bad day.
You don't mean that. You're helping those sick people.
translation.ko: 빈말인 거 알아 당신은 아픈 이들을 돕잖아

translation.en: -Let's not talk about it. -You brought it up.
-Put the window down. -Thought you were cold.
Now I'm saying I can't breathe. Put the window down.
I know you think trying somewhere else would be easier for us.
translation.ko: 다른 곳이 더 수월할 거라고 생각하는 거 알아

translation.en: South America or some such. And to a point, I agree. We should go abroad somewhere.
translation.ko: 남미 같은 곳 말이야 해외로 가잔 생각엔 동의해

translation.en: Not for a while, of course, but when the boys leave…
translation.ko: 물론 당분간은 안 되고 애들이 집을 떠나면

translation.en: -We can visit Brazil. -Visit?
Or I was thinking of one of them European schools for Junior.
translation.ko: 주니어를 유럽 학교에 보내는 건 어떨까?

translation.en: You are going to make a mollycoddle out of that boy.
Ted is the one who needs your attention, not Junior,
and you needn't think I'll let you send Junior to some nice kindergarten school
translation.ko: 난 주니어를 좋은 학교에 보낼 생각 없어

translation.en: 'cause he's getting a much-needed education.
translation.ko: 필요한 건 여기서 다 배우고 있으니까

translation.en: Sooner he learns about sex, the better. Certainly if he learns it's a grand joke.
translation.ko: 섹스도 빨리 알수록 좋아 대단한 헛짓이고 최고의 헛짓이란 걸 배워두면 좋지

translation.en: The greatest in the world.
translation.ko: 대단한 헛짓이고 최고의 헛짓이란 걸 배워두면 좋지

translation.en: -What's that supposed to mean? -Nothing.
I'm just getting a little tired of playing second fiddle
translation.ko: 소중한 흑인복지연맹에 밀려 당신에게 늘 뒷전이 되는 게

translation.en: to your precious Negro League, that's all.
How about a little charity for this Negro?
[Irene] Come on, now. There's people looking.
What's this?
-I think it's from Clare Bellew. -Clare Bellew?
[grunts] That woman from Chicago you told me about running into?
-Mm-hmm. -You gonna see her again?
I haven't opened the letter.
-It's postmarked New York. -I know.
-They must've moved here. -Brian, I'm not going to see her.
translation.ko: - 여기로 이사 왔나 봐 - 안 만날 거야

translation.en: Thought you were good friends in school.
Brian, darling, I'd have to be an idiot not to realize
if a man calls me a you-know-what, it's his fault the first time,
translation.ko: 누가 날 그런 말로 모욕하면 처음엔 그 사람 잘못이지만

translation.en: but mine if I give him the opportunity to do it again.
translation.ko: 그럴 기회를 또 주면 내 탓이야

translation.en: Sure, sure.
May I?
"I am so lonely, so lonely…"
"Cannot help longing to be with you again."
-Don't mock her. That's not fair. -I'm just reading it. [chuckles]
translation.ko: - 조롱하지 마, 그건 아니지 - 그냥 읽는 거야

translation.en: Fine.
"You can't know how in this pale life of mine,
translation.ko: '넌 모를 거야 이 창백한 삶을 살면서'

translation.en: I am all the time seeing the bright pictures of that other
translation.ko: '떠나서 기쁘다고 생각했던 그 삶의 밝은 면을'

translation.en: that I thought I was so glad to be free of."
Oh, come on, it's funny! She's very dramatic.
"It may be, Rene dear,
that your way may be the wiser and infinitely happier one."
I'm flattered. "Wiser." As if anything could rectify the humiliation…
translation.ko: 과찬이네, 더 현명해? 그 치욕은 만회 못 하는…

translation.en: Wait, wait, there's more.
"I wouldn't feel this wild desire…
if I hadn't seen you."
That's rich.
Blaming you.
"Wild desire."
Don't give her an inch.
What you so angry for anyhow?
-Husband didn't call you a-- -No, but he would've.
translation.ko: - 그 남편은 당신한테… - 날 모욕할 수도 있었어

translation.en: It amounts to the same thing.
[Brian] It has, you will admit, its humorous side.
[Irene] No, I won't.
It's not funny, it's revolting.
Irene, leave it, huh? It's normal. They always come back.
They have to work hard at getting there, why would they wanna come back?
translation.ko: 백인이 되려고 얼마나 애썼는데 왜 돌아오겠어?

translation.en: If I knew that, I'd know what race is.
translation.ko: 그걸 알면 내가 인종이 뭔지 잘 알게?

translation.en: You'd think they'd be satisfied being white.
Rot! Who's satisfied being anything?
I am.
Satisfied.
I am.
-[Brian] Let's go. Wait, Junior! -Come on, boys.
-Books, books. -Bye, Mama.
[Junior] Bye, Mama.
-[chuckles] Bye. -[door closes]
I got yams for tonight. Save the chicken for tomorrow.
translation.ko: 참마는 저녁에 먹고 닭은 내일 쓰면 돼

translation.en: Yes, ma'am.
-Did you clean the boys' room already? -Not yet.
Well, hurry. They'll be back soon and then it'll be impossible.
translation.ko: 서둘러, 곧 돌아올 텐데 그 전에 치워야지

translation.en: Can I get you something?
No. I can get it.
Redfield residence.
Yes, hello.
It's Mr. Wentworth.
Hello. Yes, Hugh.
Oh, quite, and you?
Every single one, honest. I know…
Wait, I'll give mine to Bianca. I won't need it anyway.
translation.ko: 잠깐, 비앙카한테 내 자리 줄게요 난 필요도 없어요

translation.en: -[door opens] -No, I mean it.
It was silly of me not to, I'll be so busy…
translation.ko: 진작 그래야 했는데 난 어차피 바빠요

translation.en: Well, as long as Brian has a place to drop down now and then…
translation.ko: 브라이언이 잠깐 앉을 곳만 있으면 돼요

translation.en: That's nice. My love to Bianca.
Yes, I'll see to it right away. See you tomorrow, Hugh. Bye.
[gasps, chuckles] Dear God, but aren't you lovely, Clare.
Didn't you mean to answer my letter, Rene?
translation.ko: 내 편지에 왜 답장 안 했어?

translation.en: Every day I went to that nasty little post office.
They thought I was having an affair and the man had thrown me over.
translation.ko: 다들 내가 바람피우다가 버림받은 줄 알았을걸

translation.en: -Oh! Clare, I… -Well…
Eventually it sunk in. You hadn't written to me and didn't intend to.
translation.ko: 네가 답장 안 했고 할 생각도 없단 걸 깨달았지

translation.en: I tried very hard to forget, I really did, but I couldn't.
I had to know why. That's why I came here.
Why didn't you write to me, Rene?
You see…
Well… you see…
I can't help thinking that…
you ought not to…
ought not to come up here.
-You mean you don't want me here. -No.
What I said, you ought not to run the risk.
It's terribly foolish. You must see that, and, well…
translation.ko: 어리석은 일인 거 너도 알잖아, 그리고…

translation.en: just not the right thing.
Rene, you are priceless. The right thing?
-I mean, it isn't safe. -Safe?
To come up here. Considering what I saw of Mr. Bellew's attitude.
translation.ko: 네 남편 태도를 생각하면 위험한 일이지

translation.en: Oh, of course, I understand.
And I don't blame you for being angry, Rene.
You acted beautifully that day, really beautifully. Thank you.
translation.ko: 그날 고상하게 대처해 줘서 정말 고맙게 생각해

translation.en: I don't want thanks.
I just mean that… it was very kind of you to be so delicate about it.
translation.ko: 내 말은 세심하게 배려해 줘서 고맙단 얘기야

translation.en: What other option did I have, Clare?
I have been furious at you, really furious.
-Putting me in that position. -Of course.
I can't see why you wouldn't understand why I wouldn't write.
translation.ko: 왜 답장 안 했는지 모르는 게 말이 돼?

translation.en: Foolish of me.
Why I wouldn't want anything to do with you!
Oh, no, now…
-Don't cry. -[sobbing]
I just… I feel so terrible about it all.
Oh, I… I didn't think…
I'm so very sorry, Rene.
There, there. Don't be.
I'm sorry too.
Oh, darn it. The truth is I'm very glad to see you, Clare.
translation.ko: 이러나저러나 실은 널 봐서 너무 기뻐

translation.en: Very.
Oh, and I you, Rene. You can't imagine.
translation.ko: 나도야, 리니, 넌 상상도 못 할걸

translation.en: Without that day, I would've got to the end, unable to speak to anyone.
translation.ko: 그날 널 만나지 않았으면 평생 못 털어놨을 거야

translation.en: [chuckles] You can't know.
Never anyone to really talk to.
It was insensitive of me not to think about that.
translation.ko: 나도 참 둔하지 그 생각은 못 했어

translation.en: Oh, I don't expect you to understand.
You're happy.
You have a true, good life, and you're free.
Free and safe.
Safe. [scoffs]
I don't even know what that is anymore.
I'm beginning to believe that no one is ever completely happy, free, or safe.
translation.ko: 완벽하게 행복하고 자유로우며 안전한 사람은 없는 것 같아

translation.en: Well, then, what does it matter if I come up here sometimes?
You have a child, Clare. It's not just a matter of your safety.
translation.ko: 아이가 있잖아, 클레어 네 안전만 달린 일이 아냐

translation.en: Being a mother is the cruelest thing in the world.
translation.ko: 엄마가 되는 것만큼 잔인한 일이 또 있을까

translation.en: -[maid] Hello. Redfield residence. -Yes.
[maid] One moment…
And the most responsible.
Mr. Wentworth is on the telephone again, ma'am.
[Irene] Excuse me.
Hello?
Oh, honestly, Hugh, tell her to stop being silly. I've told you it's fine.
translation.ko: 휴, 걱정 말라고 해요 괜찮다고 했잖아요

translation.en: Mm-hmm. See you tomorrow.
You sound busy.
It's this Negro Welfare League dance tomorrow.
I'm on the organizational committee. I am the committee, pretty much.
translation.ko: 난 조직 위원회야 나밖에 없어서 나 혼자 다 해

translation.en: -Hugh Wentworth, the novelist? -Yes. Do you know him?
translation.ko: - 소설가 휴 웬트워스? - 응, 잘 알아?

translation.en: -I've read a book or two of his. -You have?
-They're good, aren't they? -I suppose.
Sort of contemptuous.
Yes. Well, he's a dear, really.
Mind if I do some things around the house?
-I wasn't expecting guests. -Oh, I don't mind.
translation.ko: - 손님 올 줄 몰랐어 - 난 신경 쓰지 마

translation.en: You can show me your home.
So, Hugh Wentworth's coming up to your dance, huh?
[chuckles] Yes. Why not?
Curious to me.
A man like that going to a Negro dance.
Hundreds of white people like Hugh come to affairs in Harlem now
translation.ko: 요즘엔 할렘의 행사에 백인도 많이 와

translation.en: -Why? -Same reason you're here. To see Negroes.
What are you doing, boys?
To enjoy themselves, to get material,
to gaze on the great and near-great as they gaze on the Negroes.
Rene, suppose I come too?
-Why, because so many white people go? -No, because it'll be fun.
translation.ko: 왜? 백인도 많이 오니까? 아니, 재밌을 테니까

translation.en: I don't know. What if somebody recognizes you?
I'll take my chances on getting by.
-You'll be bored stiff. -I won't, honestly. I won't.
-I won't be able to look after you. -I'll be as good as gold.
I'll just sit there and gaze at the great and not-so-great.
Look, I don't care what you do or where you go,
translation.ko: 네가 뭘 하든 어딜 가든 상관없지만

translation.en: but I don't see why you should put yourself in a place that might bring you trouble.
translation.ko: 곤란해질 수도 있는 일을 왜 하려는 거야?

translation.en: Damn John!
He gets in the way of everything I want. I could kill him.
translation.ko: 뭘 하고 싶어도 걸림돌이야 정말 죽이고 싶다

translation.en: I wouldn't.
There's still capital punishment in this state, at least.
I want so much to be around Negroes again.
Talk with them, hear them laugh.
I've almost forgotten it…
Damn!
-Shall I go down? -No, it's nothing.
Zu will clean it.
Zu!
Come to the dance if you want to. I'm not going to stop you.
[Clare] Thank you, Rene. That's so kind of you. Really, thank you.
[Irene] Boys?
-[Junior] What do you want? We're busy. -[Irene] Junior.
Oh, now, don't be cross. I know I've gone and spoiled everything,
translation.ko: 화내지 마 나 때문에 분위기 깼지?

translation.en: but if I promise not to get in the way, will you let me in?
It will just be us for dinner.
It's just as well. I don't have any more for more.
Well, they were the cowboys and I was the Indian,
and they captured me right outside the fort.
But I think I just made my getaway.
Pay him no attention. Junior gets ahead of himself fast.
translation.ko: 주니어한테 마음 쓰지 마 금세 들떠서 앞서가는 성미거든

translation.en: Mmm. What's cooking? Yams? How you fixin' them?
-Butter, salt, sugar. Simple. -[giggles] Simple!
translation.ko: 버터, 소금, 설탕 간단하게요 간단하게! 이 세상에서 가장 완벽한 맛이지

translation.en: Why, it's just about the most perfect taste on God's earth!
translation.ko: 간단하게! 이 세상에서 가장 완벽한 맛이지

translation.en: Where did you find her, Rene?
I long for a maid who knows real home cookin'.
-[Irene] It's not like that. -Not like what?
Everyone needs help. It's normal.
-Maybe next time you can stay for dinner. -Oh, please, yes.
How about I stop by tomorrow and we can go to the dance together?
translation.ko: 내일 여기로 올 테니까 무도회에 같이 가자

translation.en: All right.
-All right. See you tomorrow, then. -Tomorrow. Yes.
-Bye, Rene. -[Irene] Mm.
-All right, come on in. -I didn't get a chance yet.
-Thought you might've fallen asleep. -No. Out on time. For once.
translation.ko: - 잠든 줄 알았어 - 설마, 오늘은 제때 준비 끝나

translation.en: Ooh, good.
-You nervous? -Hey, get off. You're sitting on my dress.
translation.ko: - 긴장돼? - 비켜, 내 드레스 깔고 앉았어

translation.en: -Clare's coming. Clare Bellew. -Hmm?
-That crazy woman, Clare? -Her, yes, her.
Crazy woman Clare Bellew.
-She's not crazy. -Since when?
Just… different.
She surprised me with a visit yesterday.
Yesterday? Why in the world didn't you tell me?
-Don't know. I had a lot to think about. -Irene.
She made it sound not such a problem if she came with us, so…
translation.ko: 우리랑 가도 별일 없을 것처럼 말하길래

translation.en: I said fine.
-She's coming here? -Any minute, I would think.
Be nice, huh?
I highly doubt it.
I mean, you be nice to her.
I will be polite.
[Irene] Gonna dress or lie there?
Quit hovering. Go wait for me downstairs.
translation.ko: 그러고 서 있지 말고 밑에서 기다려

translation.en: Wait, I'm sorry. I love you.
Boy! You are nervous.
[Clare] Oh, I thought I'd never get better.
I had such a fever. I thought I'd die. Truly.
[Brian] It was quite the epidemic. I can't recall how many cases I treated.
translation.ko: 전염병이 심각했죠 얼마나 치료했는지 기억도 안 나요

translation.en: -Not all of them made it. -Mmm.
-So you're lucky. -Yeah.
[Brian] Of course, many more survived on my watch.
-[Clare giggles] -I'm not bragging. [Clare] And what if you are?
-It's worth bragging about if it's true. -[chuckles]
You may be right.
I'm sorry, I didn't realize you were here already.
Don't worry. We made our own introductions.
Yeah, we did.
-You look lovely, Rene. -[Brian] Mm-hmm.
I'm afraid I may have chosen all wrong.
Rot! It's perfect.
-[Junior] …do it again. -[Ted] You told me.
Here they are!
Well, how do I look?
-Like a princess. -[giggling]
All right, all right.
-Good night and good night. -[Irene] Good night.
translation.ko: - 둘 다 잘 자라 - 잘 자

translation.en: I feel exactly as I used to the night before Christmas.
I knew there was a surprise waiting for me, but I could never guess what.
translation.ko: 깜짝 선물이 기다리는 건 알지만 뭔지 모르는 기분이지

translation.en: -Ah. -I'm so excited. -You can't possibly imagine. -[car horn honks]
-"You can't possibly imagine." -[Irene] Stop now.
-[woman] Hi. -[upbeat jazz music playing]
-[indistinct chatter] -[woman] That music sounds good.
[man] They'll be there.
Bianca, I am outraged.
There's Hugh!
[Brian] Anywhere to sit?
In that booth with Hugh if we can get there.
[Clare] What a hoot!
[man] There he goes!
[laughing] Felise, Dave!
-It's a triumph! The band is peachy! -It's a riot!
-Come on, Brian. We're going dancing. -[Brian] What--
-Oh, no, no, no. -Oh, yes, yes, yes, yes, yes.
Look out, Clare. The man has two left feet.
-Is that true? -No.
-Yes, it's very true. Bit rusty. -[chuckles] -Well, let's give it a go. -All right.
translation.ko: - 맞아요, 좀 녹슬긴 했죠 - 어디 봅시다

translation.en: "Poor man, rich man, beggar man, thief…" How's the rest of it go?
[Hugh] "Doctor, lawyer, Indian chief." All here and a few more.
translation.ko: '의사, 변호사, 인디언 추장' 그 외에도 여기 다 모였네

translation.en: What I'm trying to find out is the history and status
of the blonde beauty out of the fairy tale that you've brought along.
translation.ko: 동화 속 금발 미녀의 사연과 신분이야

translation.en: [Clare] See?
[Hugh] The one currently seen dancing with your husband.
She's a girl from Chicago I used to know. She's very excited I know you.
translation.ko: 시카고에서 온 동창이에요 휴를 안다니까 좋아하던데요

translation.en: -Good of her, I'm sure. -[chuckles]
[Hugh] Can you spot my wayward wife in the throng?
translation.ko: 제멋대로인 내 아내는 어디 있는지 보이나?

translation.en: Ah, yes!
Ah. The usual problem.
All these gentlemen of color have driven a mere Nordic out of her mind.
translation.ko: 유색 신사들 덕분에 나란 인간을 까맣게 잊으셨어

translation.en: [Irene] Stop!
Have I laid eyes on her tonight except in spots here and there
translation.ko: 오늘 밤에 아내를 본 적이 있냐고? 웬 에티오피아 남자랑 여기저기서 춤출 때를 빼곤

translation.en: being twirled about by some Ethiopian?
translation.ko: 웬 에티오피아 남자랑 여기저기서 춤출 때를 빼곤

translation.en: I have not.
Well, sir, you have to admit that the average colored man
translation.ko: 유색 남성이 백인 남성보다 춤을 잘 추는 걸

translation.en: is a better dancer than the average white.
That is if the celebrities who find their way up here
are fair specimens of your sort.
Having not tripped the light fantastic with any of the males,
translation.ko: 이 백인 남자들과 춤을 안 춰본 나로선

translation.en: I am hardly in a position to argue the point.
[Hugh] Bianca and Co. are always raving on
translation.ko: 비앙카랑 친구들은 항상 흑인의 외모를 찬양하지

translation.en: about the good looks of some Negro, especially an unusually dark one.
translation.ko: 비앙카랑 친구들은 항상 흑인의 외모를 찬양하지 특히 유독 검은 사람 말이야

translation.en: Like Ralph Hazelton there.
Dozens of women have declared him fantastically handsome.
translation.ko: 여자들이 입이 닳도록 저 친구의 외모를 칭찬하더군

translation.en: What do you think? Is he?
No. And I don't think anyone else would either.
It's just plain exoticism. An interest in what's different.
translation.ko: 그냥 이국적이죠 달라서 흥미를 느끼는 거예요

translation.en: A kind of emotional excitement…
Something you feel in the presence of something strange
and, even perhaps, a bit repugnant to you.
And there you have it.
So, do you subscribe to the notion
that our motives for coming up here are predatory?
[Irene] No.
More curious, I should say.
Like your princess from Chicago.
[Hugh] What is that supposed to mean?
Things aren't always what they seem, Hugh.
I'll be damned.
-Nobody could tell from looking at her. -[Hugh] No.
Most surprising.
Tell me, can you always tell the difference?
-Oh, now you really are sounding ignorant. -No, no, I mean it.
Feelings of kinship or something like that?
Stop talking to me like you're writing for the National Geographic.
I can tell same as you.
And I suppose sometimes there is a…
a thing… a thing that can't be registered.
[Hugh] Yes, I understand what you mean.
Yet, lots of people pass all the time.
It's easy for a Negro to pass for white.
translation.ko: 흑인이 백인 행세 하는 건 쉬워도

translation.en: I'm not sure it would be so simple for a white person to pass for colored.
translation.ko: 백인이 유색인종을 따라 하긴 힘들 거예요

translation.en: Never thought of that.
No, Hugh. Why should you?
Sometimes I think you could.
Yes.
And in a way, if you can, why wouldn't you?
translation.ko: 할 수 있으면 왜 안 해?

translation.en: Sorry. Hey.
-[Hugh] I'm asking, why wouldn't you? -Who's to say I'm not?
translation.ko: - 왜 안 하냐니까 - 누가 안 그런대요?

translation.en: -You're being unusually cryptic this-- -And you are being an ass.
I just mean…
we're all of us passing for something or other.
Aren't we?
An ass, am I?
Ah, my feet hurt like a… a marathon runner's.
I am in awe of your energy! [chuckles]
Well, I suppose I ought to go retrieve my wife
before some man or other steals her away from me indefinitely.
Won't you dance with me, Mr. Wentworth?
It's not quite my strong suit, Ms. Bellew.
-[Brian] Hugh. -Brian.
-Thank you. -And for you.
-Thank you. -Your husband has ruined me, Rene.
I must have another dance with him. He's the best here!
translation.ko: 한 번 더 같이 춰야겠다 여기서 최고거든

translation.en: [chuckles] I guess my wife hasn't told you that I do not respond well to flattery.
translation.ko: 아내한테 못 들었나 본데 난 누가 추켜세우면 더 못 해요

translation.en: Uh, however, I would be more than happy
to find you a suitable replacement.
Now, this… this is your man.
-[man] You? -[Clare] Yeah.
You'll do. Come along.
-[man] See ya. -[Irene laughs] He doesn't stand a chance.
[Brian] None whatsoever.
You know, I'm rather glad she came.
Isn't she extraordinarily beautiful, though?
No, not particularly.
-You're fooling! -No.
I mean, she'd be a rather unusually good-looking white woman, I suppose.
translation.ko: 클레어가 아주 예쁜 백인 여자처럼 보여도

translation.en: But personally, I like my women darker.
-Yeah? -Mm-hmm.
Maybe it's just because she was so happy.
Irene, watch yourself.
Don't find yourself responsible for that kind of happiness.
translation.ko: 그런 류의 행복에 책임감 느끼지 마

translation.en: [chuckles] Nonsense.
[man] Hey, can it!
[Junior] Clare?
[Ted] Goin' back to bed, Mama?
No, of course not, sweetie.
-Where's Clare? -She's coming later when you'll be in bed.
translation.ko: - 클레어 아줌마는요? - 네가 잘 때쯤 오실 거야

translation.en: -But she sends you special kisses. -But Pa said she'd play with me.
Ted, take your brother to the kitchen and get something to eat.
translation.ko: 테드, 동생이랑 주방 가서 뭐 좀 먹어

translation.en: I don't want something to eat.
-Ted, I said go take your… -'Scuse me.
Sorry. I told Junior Clare would be here.
What's that about?
Somebody called him a dirty…
you-know-what today.
-[Irene] Zulena? -Out back, Rene.
What in the world? Clare, aren't you freezing?
When the Lord brings you a magical day like this, I say lap it up.
translation.ko: 주님께서 이런 마법 같은 날을 주셨는데 감사히 즐겨야지

translation.en: You're crazy.
-Zu, can you help with these groceries? -They call this an Indian summer.
translation.ko: - 주, 이거 정리해 줘 - 인디언 서머라고 하죠

translation.en: -An Indian summer? -Zu.
Zu and I were just talking about the Charlestons next door.
translation.ko: 옆집에 사는 찰스턴 가족 얘기 중이었어

translation.en: -That eldest girl is getting so pretty. -She is.
Ted can barely look at her.
-Puberty makes such a mess of friendships. -[Zulena] Puberty is a mess!
Amen to that! [chuckles]
I don't know.
You had a lot of friends, as I recall.
I suppose.
Sometimes I wonder why we weren't better friends.
translation.ko: 가끔은 왜 우리가 더 잘 지내지 못했나 싶어

translation.en: Oh, we did all right.
I always admired you, though.
You were always so calm and beautiful in the face of everything.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있어도 늘 침착하고 아름다웠지

translation.en: Me? Come on, now.
You were always the beauty.
Not how I see it.
Staying for dinner?
I can't.
John's coming home.
Oh, I thought next week.
Back early.
Misses me.
Can't say I feel the same. Wish he'd stay away always. [sighs]
translation.ko: 나도 그렇다고는 못 해 늘 떨어져 있고 싶거든

translation.en: -You mustn't say that. -Mustn't I?
translation.ko: - 그런 말 하지 마 - 안 되나?

translation.en: Still coming to bridge?
Heaven forfend I miss the bridge, Rene!
[Irene] "It was dusky inside and smelled like wood and oil."
"She bumped her head on a light bulb dangling from the ceiling."
Want to take the next part?
"All that time, the rat steadied the bulb
and pulled the chain, and light flickered."
There was a lynching in Little Rock. You hear about that?
translation.ko: 리틀 록에서 발생한 폭행 사건 들었어?

translation.en: -[mouthing] Not now. -What happened?
A Black man was accused of assaulting two white women.
translation.ko: 백인 여성 둘을 폭행했다며 흑인 한 명에게 죄를 물었대

translation.en: What did he do to them?
It's less a question of "what" than "if," Ted.
-But they lynched the man anyway. -Exactly.
Junior, go brush your teeth.
They…
-chased him… -Brian.
They caught him, hung him from a telephone pole, and they shot him.
translation.ko: 그 남자를 붙잡아 전봇대에 매달고 총으로 쐈어

translation.en: -But why, Papa? -Because they hate us, son.
I said, Brian, not now.
Come here.
Seems as though we can't discuss these things
without distressing the ladies of our family.
-All right? -Yeah.
Go brush those teeth, hmm?
[Irene] I know I take being a mother rather seriously.
translation.ko: 내가 엄마 역할을 너무 진지하게 생각하는 거 알아

translation.en: I know I'm wrapped up in my boys and the running of my house.
But I don't think there's anything funny in that.
[Clare] Oh, Rene, I know.
You're so good. So perfect.
You say that like it's a bad thing.
Let's sit here a minute.
I like hearing him play.
Don't think, whatever happens, I'll forget how good you've been to me.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있어도 네가 베푼 친절은 안 잊을게

translation.en: -What are you talking about? -I mean it.
You see, I…
I don't have proper morals or a sense of duty like you.
-You're talking nonsense. -But it's true, Rene.
Don't you realize?
I'm not like you one bit.
Why, to get the things I want so badly, I'd do anything.
Hurt anybody.
Throw anything away.
Anything.
I'm not safe.
Clare, stop it.
What you're saying is wrong.
You've always had so much, you haven't given up a thing.
translation.ko: 넌 항상 풍족했고 아무것도 포기한 적 없잖아

translation.en: Clare?
[Irene] Oh, I'm sorry.
Has Mae called?
[sighs] I don't know where she could be.
Damn Zu taking the night off…
She does have to see her family from time to time.
Oh, but, we're late already and…
Well, it is my last night before I leave for Europe.
Why don't I stay with the boys and you two go?
translation.ko: 내가 애들이랑 있을 테니까 둘이 다녀올래?

translation.en: -[Brian] Really? -I don't mind.
-No, we can't leave you. -Oh, yes, you can.
And it will make the numbers even.
Well, now I really have to play bridge.
translation.ko: 오늘은 나도 브리지 참가자로 나설 수밖에 없군

translation.en: -Go on, now. -But I'll miss you, Rene.
translation.ko: - 어서 가 - 가도 네 생각만 날 거야

translation.en: No, you won't. Go on. Get.
Go on, now.
This is where all the talent is.
-[Hugh] Yeah, and the hooch. -[Irene laughs]
Where's Princess tonight?
It's a rarity having the two of you all to myself.
translation.ko: 웬일로 내가 두 사람을 독차지하게 됐을까?

translation.en: She's in Europe.
Her daughter's in boarding school. Switzerland, of all places.
-What? -Nothing. Just, uh…
What do you know about Switzerland?
Well, I shouldn't miss her too much. I find her hard work.
translation.ko: 그 여자가 딱히 그립진 않을 거야 피곤한 사람이거든

translation.en: Well, some would say the same of you.
True.
But I call it shameless, what she does. Always playing the victim.
translation.ko: 하지만 클레어는 염치가 없어 늘 피해자인 척 행동하지

translation.en: "Poor little tragic me," etcetera…
It's a low way of making yourself popular--
-I don't think that's fair. -I didn't quite finish.
translation.ko: - 그렇게 말하면 안 되죠 - 얘기 안 끝났네

translation.en: But she does maintain a certain charm.
Hugh, you hardly know the woman.
-Since she isn't here to defend herself-- -You will?
translation.ko: - 여기 없으니 변호도 못 하고… - 자네가 변호하게?

translation.en: Very chivalrous of you, I'm sure.
-[Irene] Afternoon, Lance. -Irene.
Have to let this dry before we attach it.
This is nice, isn't it? Just us four.
-I'll make some hot chocolate. -Yes, please!
[Ted] No, I want to keep talking about it.
-[Irene] You two look serious. -We're talking about John Carter.
translation.ko: - 둘 다 진지하네 - 존 카터 얘기했어요

translation.en: The one that got lynched in Little Rock.
-That again? -[Ted] You gotta know about these things.
-Do I? -Do we have any more nuts?
-I'll see. -I want some too.
You know they did more than just shoot him.
They attached his body to a caravan, dragged it through the city.
-Did you tell your father that? -He told me.
translation.ko: - 아빠한테 그 얘길 했어? - 아빠한테 들었죠

translation.en: He did?
I'm old enough not to be spoken to like a child anymore.
translation.ko: 저도 다 컸으니 애처럼 안 숨겨도 돼요

translation.en: [Junior] Thank you for dinner, Mama.
I wish you wouldn't keep talking to them about all that lynching stuff.
translation.ko: 애들한테 폭행 사건 얘긴 안 했으면 좋겠어

translation.en: Why?
There'll be time for them to learn about horrible things when they're older.
translation.ko: 그런 끔찍한 일들은 애들이 좀 더 커서 알아도 돼

translation.en: -Right now, they're safe. -You are absolutely wrong.
If you are determined to have them grow up in this damn country,
the sooner they find out, the better.
But they're happy. Why ruin that?
-I want them to stay happy. -Irene.
What is the use in keeping things from them? Hmm?
We tried to keep them from hearing the word "nigger."
-Don't use those-- -They found out the hard way.
translation.ko: - 내 집에서 그 말 쓰지 마 - 더 잔인하게 깨달았지

translation.en: You are not to talk about the race problem. I won't have it.
translation.ko: 인종 문제 꺼내지 마 난 용납 못 해

translation.en: -It is my house too. They need to know-- -They don't!
translation.ko: 내 집이기도 해, 애들이 알아야… 아냐!

translation.en: They do not.
I don't understand how someone as intelligent as you can be so stupid.
translation.ko: 이해가 안 되네 당신처럼 똑똑한 여자가 이렇게까지 어리석을 수 있다니

translation.en: I wanted to leave this hellish place years ago.
translation.ko: 몇 년 전부터 이 지옥을 떠나고 싶었어

translation.en: I have been saying we should go away for a bit.
But then you seemed happier having Clare around, so…
translation.ko: 그런데 당신은 클레어가 있어서 행복해 보이더라

translation.en: The hell has Clare got to do with--
Only that we would have gone on a trip but for that.
I gave up that idea because you objected…
-I never objected to having Clare-- -God damn it!
Irene, I'm not talking about Clare.
-It seems-- -I'm not talking about a trip!
I am talking about leaving this--
It seems to me you are a lot less content with what you've got when she's not here.
translation.ko: 클레어가 없어서 삶이 만족스럽지 않은 거잖아

translation.en: [Clare] Not how I see it.No.
I'm getting up.
Don't worry.
-It was good of you to think to call me. -Always the attentive husband.
translation.ko: - 부르러 와줘서 고마워 - 늘 자상한 남편이잖아

translation.en: All of those people coming to tea.
Thank goodness everything is ready.
-Clare's downstairs. -Clare? How?
I didn't invite her, purposely.
Uh, she's been back for a while. Zu's always taking messages,
translation.ko: 돌아온 지 꽤 됐대 주가 계속 메시지 전했는데

translation.en: and you never seem to respond.
Might a mere man ask why?
This party is for Hugh, and Hugh happens not to care a great deal for her, so…
translation.ko: 휴를 위한 파티인데 클레어를 달가워하지 않아서

translation.en: I didn't ask her.
If you ask me, his dislike has less to do with her
translation.ko: 휴는 클레어가 뭘 어째서 싫어하는 게 아니라

translation.en: and more to do with the attention she happens to not give him very much of.
translation.ko: 본인한테 별 관심을 안 보여서 그런 거야

translation.en: -You love Hugh. -I do.
But you'll admit he has a godlike opinion of himself.
I disagree.
He thinks far better of himself than that. [giggles]
Brian?
I'm sorry. It's my fault, Irene.
She seemed hurt at being left out. I told her I was sure you'd forgotten.
translation.ko: 자기만 빠졌다고 속상해하길래 당신이 깜빡했을 거라고 했어

translation.en: But, Brian, I…
You spoke to her, then?
Yes.
Of course you did.
In spite of what I said, Clare does add to any party.
translation.ko: 내가 뭐라고 한들 클레어는 파티를 빛내주잖아

translation.en: She's so easy on the eyes.
You won't be long?
-[woman 1] Thank you. -[Irene] Sorry.
[woman 2] We're all discussing La Josephine. You've seen her, I presume?
translation.ko: 조세핀 얘기 중이에요 본 적 있죠?

translation.en: -[Irene] Josephine Baker? No, never. -[man] You're missing out.
translation.ko: - 조세핀 베이커요? 못 봤어요 - 꼭 보세요

translation.en: [Irene] She may have been in Shuffle Along when I saw it,
but I can't remember.
[woman 2] I much prefer her to Ethel Waters.
[Irene] Ethel Waters is awfully good.
Hello, Felise, so glad you made it.
[Felise] Oh, come back. Irene.
-You haven't sat down all afternoon. -[Irene breathing heavily]
[Felise] I wanna talk to you.
Come out of it, whatever it is. You look like the second gravedigger.
translation.ko: 무슨 생각을 그렇게 골똘히 해? 너무 우울해 보여

translation.en: [Irene] I'm not quite feeling up to par.
-The weather, I guess. -[Felise] Buy yourself an expensive frock.
translation.ko: - 날씨 때문인가 봐 - 비싼 드레스 하나 사

translation.en: It always helps.
I have been trying to get her alone all afternoon. Clare!
translation.ko: 오후 내내 클레어랑 얘기하려고 했는데, 클레어!

translation.en: You look too divine, sitting so quiet like a painting!
-Come over for a gathering next month. -You must!
[Clare] I was telling Dave I just finished his book.
translation.ko: 펠리스, 데이브 책을 봤다고 얘기 중이었어요

translation.en: -[Felise] You've read his books? -Of course, I've read all of 'em!
So sorry, Rene, I must've pushed you. Clumsy of me.
translation.ko: 미안하네, 내가 밀쳤나 보군 칠칠맞지 못하게

translation.en: Don't tell me, it's priceless and irreplaceable?
No, you didn't push me, I'm quite sure.
That pot was the ugliest thing
that your ancestors, the charming Confederates, ever owned.
translation.ko: 휴의 멋진 조상인 남부 연합군의 소유물이었죠

translation.en: I've forgotten how many thousands of years ago it was
that Brian's great-great-great-great uncle owned it…
translation.ko: 브라이언의 아주 먼 조상이 소유했을 테지만요

translation.en: What I mean is I never figured out how to get rid of it till just this minute.
Inspiration! I had only to break it, and I was free of it forever.
translation.ko: 몰랐네요, 깨뜨리기만 하면 영원히 해방되는 걸

translation.en: -[chuckles] Simple. -Well done.
-[Hugh] My lovely. -[woman] Oh, that was wonderful.
Well done.
Brian, thank you so much for a tea party that…
-Bye, Rene. -…can never be matched.
-Staying for dinner? -Oh, I can't tonight.
Oh. Right. Too bad. Brian's got work, anyway.
-So glad to see you. -So long.
Thank you so much. We had a marvelous time.
Good to see you. Thank you.
-[Junior] Then I beat Patrick in a race. -[Brian] Hat! Hat!
Race you up the steps! Can't catch me.
translation.ko: 계단 끝까지 시합하자! 난 못 잡을걸

translation.en: [Ted] I'm not letting you have it. No!
Evening.
[Felise] My goodness.
-Heavens, my eyes are watering. -I fear my fingers might fall off.
translation.ko: - 눈물이 다 나네 - 손가락 떨어질까 겁난다

translation.en: -[giggling] -This wind is brutal!
[John] Excuse me.
Oh, Mrs. Redfield! How do you do?
That was abrupt.
You just passed the only person I ever met while disguised as a white woman.
translation.ko: 내가 백인 행세 할 때 유일하게 마주쳤던 사람이야

translation.en: Hello, Central Quincy 5-4-7-3.
Hello, is Mrs. Bellew in? It's urgent.
translation.ko: 여보세요? 벨류 부인 있어요? 급한 일이에요

translation.en: No?
Never mind.
It isn't that urgent.
I'll try again later.
[Brian] Irene.
Irene.
What are you doing? It's freezing.
Are we going to that party with Clare?
Have you ever been up to the sixth floor?
[Clare] Of course! My father was a janitor.
[Clare] Back in the old days when every ramshackle apartment had its own elevator.
translation.ko: 예전엔 낡은 아파트에도 엘리베이터가 다 있었어요

translation.en: [Brian] Elevator?
-Oh, you can't mean we have to walk up? -[chuckles] All the way to the top.
[Clare] Oh, Lord!
Why on earth would anyone live here?
She says it discourages the casual visitor.
-Says she'd rather be dead than bored! -Huh.
Damn these thin shoes.
What is it, Rene?
Have you ever thought of what you'd do if John found out?
translation.ko: 존이 알면 어떻게 할지 생각해 봤어?

translation.en: Yes.
[Brian] Don't fall by the wayside before the fourth floor.
I absolutely refuse to carry anybody up more than two flights.
translation.ko: 두 층 이상 업는 건 사양하죠

translation.en: And? What would you?
I'd do what I want more than anything right now.
translation.ko: 내 마음이 가는 대로 할 거야

translation.en: I'd come up here to live.
In Harlem. With you.
Lord.
Come on, slowpoke.
[Dave] …dinner at Eddie's, then Leroy's, then Smalls.
Those dancers seem strange to anyone else?
-No, honey, just the liquor. -That's why I've given it up.
translation.ko: - 여보, 그건 술 탓이야 - 그래서 끊었지

translation.en: -Since this morning? -Yes.
And nothing in the least exciting has happened--
translation.ko: 덕분에 재밌는 일이 도통 안 생겨

translation.en: -You're welcome. -Thank you.
I wouldn't. I've heard the drinks here aren't safe.
[Dave] Irene, have you taken a vow not to laugh again?
No. It's simply the rest of you are so clever, I'm speechless.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 다들 말주변이 좋으니 잠자코 있는 거죠

translation.en: You haven't a drink. What will you take?
Ginger ale and three drams of scotch.
Scotch first, then the ice, then the ginger ale.
[Felise] Don't attempt to mix that yourself, Dave, honey.
-Have the butler make it. -[Irene] And the footman, would you?
-Yes, it's a perfect evening. -Good.
[Dave] Don't stand there. Aren't you freezing?
translation.ko: 거기 서 있지 마요, 안 추워요?

translation.en: [Dave] Come. Come talk to me, or at least listen to me gabble.
translation.ko: 갑시다, 나랑 얘기해요 내 수다라도 들어줘요

translation.en: -[man 1] Evening, can I help you? -[John] Let me in.
[man 1] Perhaps you've come to the wrong house. [John] I know where I am. Let me in.
translation.ko: - 잘못 오신 것 같은데요 - 제대로 왔어요, 들어간다고요

translation.en: [man 2] Which apartment are you looking for, sir?
-[John] My wife is in there. -[man 1] Your wife?
No, sir, she's not here. I guarantee it.
-[man 2] Excuse me, I think you're wrong. -[John] I'm not wrong.
-[man 1] Do not come in! -[man 2] Sir, calm down.
-[man 3] What's going on? -[John] Out of my way.
Can I help you?
[John] I've been to the Redfields' and I know she's with them.
translation.ko: 레드필드 집에 갔더니 여기 있다고 하더군요

translation.en: Ralph, where's my drink?
[John] Save yourself the trouble and get out of my way.
I know what you're doing here. I know.
translation.ko: 여기서 뭘 하는지 다 알고 왔다고요

translation.en: I'm Redfield. What the devil's the matter--
You don't get to tell me what to do! Any of you people!
translation.ko: 나한테 명령하지 마! 너희 중 그 누구도!

translation.en: [Dave] It's best you leave.
You liar!
[Felise] Careful. You're the only white man here.
You dirty liar.
-Good Lord Jesus! -[indistinct chatter]
-[man 1] Hurry. -[man 2] Quickly!
Quickly!
Go downstairs.
[man 1] Her husband's just sitting there?
[man 2] I don't know.
[man 1] You don't know? [man 2] I don't know for sure if she's dead.
[man 3] I imagine he was just trying to protect his wife.
[man 4] Doesn't strike me as particularly unusual.
[Irene] Is she…
Is she…
Irene, you mustn't.
You'll make yourself sick.
[man 3] I mean, she just tumbled over and was gone.
[Dave] Irene was there beside her, weren't you? [officer] This lady here?
You're sure she fell?
Her husband didn't give her a shove or anything,
as Dr. Redfield here seems to think?
No. I'm quite sure she just fell before anyone could stop her.
It was so quick, I…
-Careful. -[officer] Anyone else notice anything?
-You mustn't. -[officer] None of you saw how she fell?
translation.ko: - 안 돼 - 어쩌다 추락했는지 못 봤어요?

translation.en: -[Felise] He was upset, that's true. -[officer] So an accident?
translation.ko: - 남편이 화를 내긴 했는데… - 그럼 사고였군요?

translation.en: [Felise] I guess an accident, yeah.
That's what I thought.
[whispers] I love you.
[officer] Death by misadventure, I'm inclined to believe.
Let's go up and have a look at that window.
